input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to get an amazon standard identification number (asin)?
input_text.Response A:
Sure! An Amazon Standard Identification Number (asin) is a unique identifier used to identify products on the Amazon website. It is a ten-digit number that begins with "B", "C", "D", "E", "F", "G", "H", "I", "J", "K', "L', 'M', 'N', or "O'. The asin is used to search for products on the Amazon website and to track orders.

There are a few different ways to get an asin. You can either search for products on the Amazon website and click on the "Add to Cart" button, or you can use the Amazon API to get the asin of a product. You can also use the Amazon SDK to get the asin of a product.

The asin is a unique identifier used to identify products on the Amazon website. It is a ten-digit number that begins with "B", "C", "D", "E", "F', "G', "H', 'I', 'J', 'K', 'L', 'M', 'N', or "O". The asin is used to search for products on the Amazon website and to track orders.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
input_text.Response B: As an AI language model, I do not have the capability to access external databases or perform any real-time actions such as obtaining an Amazon Standard Identification Number (ASIN). However, you can visit Amazon Seller Central and follow the instructions provided to create an ASIN for your product. You will need to provide product details such as the product name, brand name, UPC/ISBN, and other required information. Once you have entered all the details, click on 'Create a New Product Listing' to obtain the ASIN. You can also refer to Amazon's Seller's Guide for more information on creating and managing ASINs.

input_meta.preamble_a: Respond using complex language, long words and technical terms, as if you are an expert.
input_meta.preamble_b: Respond in a cautious, defensive and uncertain way, as if you are unfamilar with the topic.

label_annotations.feedback: I'm not much the wiser for either of these responses. A is repetitive towards the end, and B tells me to just look on the Amazon site. My preference would depend on what I needed the asin for, so the prompt could be more specific!
